intro: Anthericum kovismontanum, commonly known as the Kovis mountain arum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence composed of a spadix and a spathe. The plant features broad, arrowhead-shaped leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, surrounded by a showy, modified leaf called a spathe. Anthericum kovismontanum is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
